availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
District of Columbia
Washington County } SS.

I, Charles Walter duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky, resident at Washington City in the District of Columbia, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky.

Chas Walter
Commissioner for Kentucky in Washington D, C,

figure.ab:
CHARLES WALTER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS FOR KENTUCKY
DIST OF COLUMBIA

body.p: Subscribed and sworn to this 11th day of October A. D. 1862 before me

Jno A. Smith Clk
Crt Ct Washn Co. Dist of Col'a

Oath.
Chas Walter
Comr of Deeds
Filed Octo 15. 1862
